I got a cup of vegan chili ($3.75) which came with a piece of cornbread. The chili was okay but not great. While it was spicy, I didn't like the overly-thick nature of it and the uninteresting ingredients. Where were the bell peppers? Or mushrooms? Or tvp? All this chili had was tomatoes, onions and beans which are okay, I guess, but pretty boring.  The cornbread was good, though. The service was friendly too. I generally like the atmosphere here (cozy and dark with lots of wood and a long bar). The beer selection and draft selections are also both unusual and extensive (with lots of local beers).  I just wish Weary Traveler had better vegan options. Then I'd come back often and I'm sure other vegans/vegetarians would as well.

I used to live less than a block form the weary traveler when I lived in Madison, and wanted to see if it had lost its charm. Nope.  It's so warm and inviting. Food is nothing less than awesome. I was disappointed that the vegan chili isn't on the menu anymore, but I settled for the stand-by walleye sandwich. Soooo good.  Drinks...I don't remember them being that cheap. But I guess they are. Service never has been that great, but eh...it wasn't bad. Just a hipster attitude that really isn't necessary.  Also, bad move replacing Quolfrisch with Stella. Not. Good. That's why you lose a star. And the tude. But I'll definitely go back whenever I'm in town.

Eclectic restaurant for an eclectic town. Cool Worldy travel decorations around the world. It is a bit dark inside to appeal to the ambience, which was neat!   I have been here a few times and enjoyed every visit. On my last visit, I noticed their shelf of board and card games and started playing the "Bad Beets" game. The food came so we left the game unfinished. The Tom Kha Soup with tofu was really good. We ordered a side of rice, the wild black rice, to mix in with the soup. It normally doesn't come with the rice, but the bartender said customers usually ordered the soup with a side of rice.  Tried the snack platter as well, which came with guacamole, salsa, and pickled veggies. Watch out for the pickled garlic! I love garlic, but I could only handle one clove bite which gave me breath a lasting overnight garlic breath even after brushing my teeth. The ratio of chips to salsa and guac were a little uneven. There were more chips than the dip. Either way, it was tasty!  Drinks wise we tried the spiked decaf coffee with whipped cream; I expected it to be hot and it was a little cooler, probably from the cool whipped cream. I was offered an extra side of whipped cream because it was good despite the temperature.   Crowd wise, it was always busy. They do not accept reservations, so prepare to wait or hope to get seats at the bar

Very Madison.  If you're from out of town you have to stop here!  Whether it is just for drinks or for food, you will not be disappointed.  The food is simple and not complicated.  The staff is friendly.  Cozy atmosphere.

I had a great experience here and suggest a visit for something "different" in a good way.It was a cozy atmosphere with a lot of people but it was fun. Food was great, quick service. The place was full the few times I've been here and we've had to wait but it was well worth it.

Came here for Sunday brunch. Was immediately struck by the decor of the place, especially a painting of what looked to be a hipster Draco Malfoy. Ordered the steak and eggs, which was pretty solid. Flank steak, so nothing spectacular, but mine was cooked a perfect medium-rare, and was seasoned perfectly. Also came with toast and a fig preserve jam, which was great as well. Pico de gallo too, always a plus. Definitely plan on coming back.

I sure wish I'd come hungry....in any event, with the 87 degree temps yesterday, I was powerfully THIRSTY. Since I'd started with vodka earlier, I asked the bartender to surprise me with a big vodka drink to quench my thirst. She came back with a vodka Tom Collins, with muddled lemons in the bottom of the glass, and it was fabulous! I have a new summer cocktail, and here's the best part: $3.50 each! I told her she must've undercharged me, with a $7 tab, but she said that was the price for bar vodka.   I will definitely be back and hopefully try that Walleye sandwich and potatoes that Heather T. raves about.
Awesome food. Awesome atmosphere. I've never had a bad experience with the wait staff. Occasionally it gets busy and it takes a little longer but that's to be expected. I love this place.
Grilled cheese was great, but the Hungarian Ghoulash is not to be missed!

This place should also be listed under "Night Life" category. I stopped by here with my friend for a beer. I liked the board game selections - I can definitely come here again just play some games while getting buzzed.   The cool part is their beer selection. Thank YOU for having Lake Louis beers on the menu. I don't always see Lake Louis scotch ale (my favorite) at every bar in Madison, so kudos to Weary Traveler for having the solid standard for what beer to serve.   Good atmosphere, but I don't know how attentive the servers are .... . I'd love to try their food next time around.
Fantastic spot to get a great meal and a delicious brew. Their Rueben was great, but what really did it for me was the bacon potato salad. Definitely a place to check out if you're from out-of-town.
Yum! My favorites are the Walleye sandwich or the Ruben. Good beer and wine list. Have been coming here for many years and its always good. Service can be a bit slow when the place is packed.

Yes, it's hard to figure out who to talk to in order to get a table on a busy night. Yes, it's an uncomfortable wait. Yes, the tables are uncomfortably close. Yes, the waitstaff is stretched thin and very busy. Yes, there can be a long wait for your food. . BUT! The entrees and soups are AMAZING! I love the veggie West of the Andes Sandwich. The Tom Ka Tofu is very good too. The appetizers are just ok (but I still order them).  We've had good luck getting a table and food quickly on weekday nights.

Arriving early for dinner with a friend from out of town, I sat at the bar and enjoyed a somewhat obscure local beer that was absolutely outstanding. Like many others, I'm in love with the interior of the place. Homey, quaint, cozy, filled with antiquities, it's awesome.   Not so awesome is how cold it was inside, on the coldest night of the winter so far. The curtain that separates the entrance from the entry door isn't very effective at keeping the icy blasts at bay. Maybe add another curtain? Luckily most of the year this shouldn't be a big issue.  My friend arrived and we moved to a table. We'd both checked out the menu online so we knew what we wanted, but the service was very, very, very slow. There was some kind of issue going on in the kitchen and our waitress was clearly frazzled by it. I felt bad because my friend was very hungry after traveling all day. We were seated at around 5:30 and it was after 8 when we left. I'm going to estimate it took over an hour to receive our dinner. My friend loved her warming, flavorful beef goulash, and my sandwich, a cubano type, was delicious. Two things, though. The housemade potato bread it was served on was very good, tender and pillowy, but there was way too much of it compared to the (top notch, locally sourced, flavorful) ingredients inside. It was also cold.   I'll go back for the vibrant, evocative-of-another-time ambiance, the delicious pro-locavore offerings, but I'll go earlier than when I expect to be actually hungry. And I'll dress more warmly.

This place tops our list for lunch dates or date nights!  We love the beer selection and local ingredients- Something we always look for when selecting a place to support! We are always so impressed with the menu and the staff is very friendly.  You really can't go wrong here!

I love this place. The food is amazing, the atmosphere is homey, and I love looking at all the old musical instruments on the walls while I eat.   I particularly recommend the West of the Andes or the Carne Asada plate.

Great burger, good vibe, great service. Really the Bobs Bad Breath burger is one of the best I've ever had. Perfectly cooked beef patty, carmelized onions, tomato and yummy cheese. Even the bun is awesome. It came with garlic sliced potatoes and a mixed green side salad but who even noticed next to the burger.

As I walked in I decided that I was going to like this place.  Cool place in the cool part of Madison.....   But unfortunately I can't say I loved it.  The Bloody Mary's were top notch.  Filled with a great assortment of vegetables and a beer chaser.... Great start.   The food unfortunately was a let down.  I had the Reuben which was okay and the sides that come with it where good.  Nothing that really great.  I read all the "bad breath burger" reviews on yelp (mostly good).  We ordered one and no one liked it.  First of all it was very dry and I just couldn't get into the flavors.  Garlic and cream cheese?  It just wasn't for me.  I liked the vibe of the place and the drinks...  A big not sure on the food.

It was difficult to find the front door... well there were a couple of front doors but I struggled to find the right one. Once in the lunch crowd had yet to materialize so I had free range to pick a seat. The bar was open and had the best vantage point for taking it all in. There is a amazing amount of eclectic memories on the walls everywhere. After an exceedingly long period, I finally got my chicken order and subbed a salad for the potatoes. The chicken must be organic and healthy for me by the size of it but for me i prefer by chicken to be hopped up on hormones and spilling off the plate. The skin was nice and crispy and the breast was a little dry. The green beans were nice and fresh as was the salad. With so many other better options, I don't see myself coming back.
Bob's bad breath burger... check it out. You won't be disappointed. ;)

I still vividly fantasize about the goulash at this place.  We were (whoaaa) LITERALLY weary travelers who, assisted by yelp searching, stopped here for dinner after days of driving east on 90, and the goulash was basically like breast milk: warm, comforting, perfect, seemingly tailor-made for my exact needs, and something I will probably never be able to revisit.  My standards and will to live after a week in the car may have been compromised, but damn did this hit the spot.  My dad got the Bad Breath Burger (and yes, the beef is rosy, fresh, house-ground organic Wisconsin beef, so go as rare as you dare) and my sister got a sandwich that I think was fairly inauthentically branded as "Andean" but which was still outstanding.  The interior smacks of generic rustic gastropub in the best way possible, and I recall our waiter being very affable, despite the place being totally swamped on a weekend night.

Surprise, surprise...right?  Here's a list of why Weary gets 4 stars:  1)  It's a fun place to go to.  I almost always end up having a fun conversation with the bartender or my server.  There does seem to be a new guy serving there now who is kind of weird.  I can't say for certain though because he didn't serve me.  2)  The atmosphere is eclectic to the extreme.  Every time I go I find something else on display, and I find myself wondering if it was there before.  "How could I have missed THAT!?", I ask myself.  3)  The food.  Bob's burger is as unique a burger as you'll find in Madison...and it tastes great.  The potatoes that come with it are usually done VERY well and are, to me, more delicious than anything there.  The small side salad is simple and tasty.  I've also eaten the meat and cheese platter.  I ordered that on my own, and I'm pretty sure I ordered the medium.  When it showed up, I knew I should have ordered the small.  HUGE is how I can best describe this plate.  Oh, and it's good too.  I've had a special here and there, and they're always good.  I've really never been disappointed by the food.  4)  The beer.  Ok, the selection is limited.  They have Two-Hearted on tap though, and that's good enough for me since it's the best (?) IPA ever made.  5)  The location.  I like it because it's close to home.  There are other restaurants that are closer though, and I have never gone to them (or never gone back).
best place to teach someone how to play yahtzee and get wasted.

Call me nostalgic. Call me stupid. I'm still trying to figure out why we came back here for dinner after so many bad experiences. If you come for the drinks and atmosphere, then good on ya - probably a satisfactory venue. But they lost their groove on the food.  For at least the past 3 or 4 times, the potatoes are served cold. Just plain cold. The infamous Bob's Bad Breath burger and the walleye sandwich were also cold. The service wasn't slow, but the place was busy. When notified of the problem the waitress was kind enough to replace our cold potatoes with fresh, hot ones, and was very pleasant and polite about it. But don't serve me cold food in the first place. We decided after tonight's experience we would have rather gone hungry than spend $35 on meals + one beer each for the two of us. Madison, what gives? Why aren't we holding Bob to higher standards? Disappointed in this neighborhood venue. Used to be such a destination and now it's one to avoid.

The menu is "hipster eclectic" if that makes sense, which is their overall theme.  The ambiance compliments the menu. We tried the coconut Thai curry soup which was very flavorful and delish, both the cups & bowls are Hefty portions which is reflected in the price. The soup does have rather large chunks of vegetables so be 'weary' of that. Steak sandwich also quite flavorful, good bread and pico.  As long as you can find something in the menu to your liking, The Weary Traveler is a great lunch or dinner spot!

We rode our bikes a half century and decided to reward ourselves with Bob's Bad Breath Burger! We came in around 5:30 on a Friday night... not very busy yet, so we took a seat and when the waiter came, we ordered two brandy old fashioned and asked for a few minutes to wash our hands and check out the menu.  The waiter came back in a timely manner and my friend said she was ready to order and ordered the BBB with no caramelized onions with extra greens on the side and the House chips that come with it.  I was going to get the exact same but when I asked the waiter what all came ON the burger since my friend didn't want onions- his reply was "you can read it in the menu" - EXCUSE ME? Yes I can but when a paying customer asks a question about the menu items it's customary and good practice to answer them straight away instead of using snarky responses.  Needless to say the waiter soured my experience and I doubt I'll return to a establishment that doesn't value my business!  The BOBS BAD BREATH BURGER was ok but not worth being treated rudely; too may other good burgers in Madison to put up with this.

Ate a nice dinner here and would highly recommend. There was immediate seating around 6 on a Saturday over the summer. I got the carne asada plate and it was so fresh and delicious. I would go back to try the other yummy looking things on the menu for sure. It looked like they used local and fresh ingredients and had fantastic offerings. Service was also great as well.

I wish I could have given this zero stars. My co-workers and I went into the Weary Traveler the other day for lunch - none of us have ever been there but we all heard relatively good things of the place.   When we first entered, the initial shock was how cold the place was. I know that we were going through the midst of the Polar Vortex this week, but seriously there was very little difference in temperature from outside to inside.   The service was average at best, nothing to write home about except that our server appeared to be very disheveled and possibly might have missed a shower or two.. or three....  Our food arrived, again nothing spectacular.   But that is where the fun begins... The next day when we all got to the office and reviewed the lunch from the day prior we all began to realize that each of us had come down with some sort of illness. None of us were sick the previous day (or the previous month). The only thing that we can attribute our illness to is this place.   All I know that is after going through 48 hours of a fever mixed in with severe nausea and a horrible cough, this place is not  worth EVER eating again.

The menu was creative.  Some of the plates we saw coming out of the kitchen looked pretty good. I would have liked to see real field greens in my plate instead of a bagged mix.  The sandwich I ordered didn't fill the bun which was a disappointment.  It doesn't take much to throw a little extra meat and vegetables in a sandwich (steak). My partner's reuben was OK.  Again, add a little more meat.  The craft beer selection could use a little more local flavor with all the great choices in the Madison area.
Great drink selection. Good place to eat if you're vegetarian/vegan, because they have plenty of options for you. The service was a little slow while we were there, but it was a busy night.

This place has a seriously cozy vibe with eclectic decor and great food. The menu is small but varies from vegan chili to elk burgers, goulash or Thai seasoned tofu. It is a favorite place to bring a small group with varied taste when people come to town. The hot drinks after dinner are a nice touch for Wisconsin. I recommend the Mexican sampler for a shared appetizer. The pickled veggies are excellent.

I love this place! Great east side laidback ambience. Healthy food and great beer selection. I had their Seasonal Superfood Salad and it was delicious. Creamy goat cheese and roasted Brussel sprouts and squash on mixed greens. Sooo yummy!

Our first time here and we thoroughly enjoyed the experience.  A bit of a wait for a table, no problem, waited at the bar.  It was VERY busy though, service was pretty attentive so, it was fine.  Seating is a little cramped and it's definitely a "buzzing" place....lots of background chatter from other diners, etc.  The decor is quite cool.  Food was very good.  We tried the pork chop over greens and the fried chicken.  Both were cooked very nicely.  I asked for my chop medium rare, and it actually was medium rare.  For some reason....it seems like so many places will only cook chops to medium well or well....wtf is the point of buying a good chop if you're going to turn it into shoe leather?  please!  So, yes...definitely pleased with the food and will be back, for sure!  Hint:  Parking can be a little tough...just plan on parking on a side street and walking a block or two....

I live in the neighborhood and go to weary traveler probably once every 2 weeks. I love the decor and the chicken diijonaise and the bad breath burger. Good wine and beer as well. This is probably the best value meal in Madison for good quality food. My one complaint is that we've waited a ridiculous amount of time for food before with no explanation at all. I can wait 45 minutes if I've been warned and the food comes out hot but it's hard to grin and bear it after 40 minutes or more and the food comes out cold. I think WT might have an issue with staff scheduling. The good food and atmosphere will keep me coming back for now though.

I'm not a big 5 star guy... but The Weary Traveler really does itself well.  You could always find an issue to pick something apart... so let's list those out now: figuring out where to sit if you're new to the place, the music that some of the bartenders play too loud, the one meal that I didn't like, and... um... okay, done.  Now, for what's good.  This place doesn't even have a deep fryer.  When it comes to the food, they take their time, they put it together well, and they use exceptional ingredients.  The West of the Andes sandwich, the Chili (with meat), the Tom Ka Tofu, are all favorites of mine.  I also like the Carne Asada, because the plate comes with great pickled veggies, fresh guacamole, nicely spiced sirloin, and a whole bunch of chips.  Cut up that meat, mix the pieces together, and you've got a killer dip for dinner... go ahead, try it, you'll like it... I promise.  In other news, the bartenders are friendly but generally not up for much conversation.  The place is just as good for a couple of drinks as it is for dinner, and they have some great larger tables for some friends to get together and take advantage of their extensive board games collection in the back corner.  It is also open late and serves dinner until 1am... which is a major plus as Madison tends to shut down much earlier.  A local, cozy, affordable, quality, friendly bar/restaurant that never disappoints... 5 of 5.

I'm a visitor from out of town, visiting my family. Looking for a great place to eat with a great atmosphere. I thought it was the weary traveler. Unfortunately I find myself a weary traveler, as I sit in this establishment. Our waitress seems very angry. We walked in and we must have done something wrong? Unfortunately we are only having a drink and leaving. We will walk across the street to and find somewhere else to eat.   Edit: we ended up going to Bunkies. We called ahead to see when they opened and they opened an hour early for us. They were super friendly and the food was great.
Great bar with great food. Great atmosphere with everyone from students to long term residents of the area. Small menu but super high quality. Only downfall is parking but worth the walk.

I am finally comfortable saying that The Weary Traveler has the best burger in Madison.  It took a lot of eating, but after 3 visits to the WT, and trial and error at other restaurants, I know Bob's Bad Breath Burger is unbeatable!  Always juicy and perfectly cooked, the toppings go wonderfully together, and it's pretty big.  Yes, you will literally be able to taste your breath afterwards, so I suggest having your date order the same burger!

Always great food and a lot of variety for vegetarians. A few of the waiters/waitresses can be a bit stuck up, I ordered a very peculiar tasting margarita (it tasted like salty water) and when I asked them to take it back (I don't usually do this), I was told that there's nothing wrong with how it was made. I felt the comment was unnecessary. However, I'm always very pleased with the food.

Mmm, I always have a good meal when I come to the Weary Traveler. However, I have to say, I think it's over-rated.  I've been about 3-4 times since living just 2 blocks away. I've tried the Andes sandwich, both with tuna and pork. Pretty tasty. I had a grilled cheese last time, which came out luke warm and was sort of dry. I asked the waitress to bring a sauce to give the sandwich some spunk. She brought the goddess sauce, which was yummy. I do love the side of mixed greens with vinaigrette.   I think the Weary Traveler could add a few things to the menu, or at least have seasonal specials. They do have a decent beer selection and I like the atmosphere.
Nice ambiance, good food, fine service.  Tap menu could be more impressive.  Have enjoyed the bad breath burger and the west Andes sandwich. Recommend trying their kambucha and vodka.

Snotty, pretentious servers, CRAPPY service, loud, obnoxious hipsters, and the sexxay-acting, stuck-up waitress hit on my friend (even going so far as to sit in his lap, eww!), thinking he was paying the tab and shit? Well, I was paying the tab. Oops. I don't care how good the food, is- bad service is a deal breaker for me. Ugh.

The Weary is always a go-to for me when I have visitors come to Madison. The environment is warm and fairly intimate and the menu is small, but great. I usually get the Tom Kha Tofu, which I could eat every day and not get sick of it. The kombucha cocktails are interesting and worth a try. I would recommend coming here off peak hours though, because sometimes there is a wait.

This place has it all for me. The atmosphere is relaxing and welcoming, the food is delicious and locally sourced, their kitchen stays open late, and it is within walking distance from my house. I recommend the West of the Andes sandwich. The servers are friendly and the bartenders have been nothing but polite and happy to chat about the beer on tap or their favorite cocktails.  It can get packed on the weekends during dinner so plan on getting there early if you are with a large group. Parking can be challenging on the weekends too.

This weary traveler loves finding a nice spot for lunch while on the road.  My husband and I were on our way to LaCrosse for a wedding with some time built in for lunch.  We were close to Madison twoish on Saturday and I started checking out places on Yelp.  This one was open and seemed to be just the right spot for a late lunch.  It was a great choice, thanks Yelp and specifically Molly O.!  I liked the whole feel of the place from the heavy wooden tables to the phones repurposed as lamps.  I sortof wanted one but they weren't for sale!  There was only one other table when we were there and I appreciated them clearing out the place for us!   Our server was quick and efficient and helped us get a nice lunch and on our way.  I had the West of the Andes sandwich with the beef tenderloin.  Melt in your mouth wonderfulness!  I loved the avocado plus the slight kick from the chipotle mayonnaise.  Pair it with a glass of iced tea and I was happy we had stopped.  To get off the highway, have a civilized tasty meal and get back on the highway took maybe an hour but hey, we needed gas also, a twofer!  I suggest you do the same while traveling, use Yelp to make your meals a cut above burgers on the side of the road.  And if you are near Madison, come rest and have a repast at the Weary Traveler!
My favorite neighborhood spot.  Comforting, warm, yummy. The walleye sandwich is the best.
Great brunch menu and bloody mary's.

Great atmosphere, great beer selection, great food! The chili is mad tasty. The beer selection is large and rotating with lots of local stuff. This is a farm to table type place so they serve it up tasty.  Give it a shot of your feet lead you here.

So I just found out the Weary Traveler has a Brunch.  I was meeting a friend and he suggested them.  I got there around 1 pm and I easily found a seat. My companion was late and the server checked on me several times to see if I needed anything while I waited.  I did end up ordered a Celtic coffee.  This lovely coffee is sweet and stinging with the Irish cream, whiskey, and fresh whipped cream.  I would get that again.  This funky spot looks like an adult version of Ella's Deli.  While I waited for my friend, I enjoyed looking around at the telephone lamps and the wall decorations.  The door you walk through to get to the dining/bar area is a gorgeous wood design.   When my pal did arrive, we ordered.  I had the French toast with a side of sausage.  The sourdough bread was large and yummy.  The sausage was a different texture than I was used, too.  Next time, I would try the bacon.  It was a big yummy breakfast, just what I wanted on a Sunday afternoon.  My pal ordered the Walleye Sandwich.  He has had it many times before.  I enjoyed looking at the generously sized sandwich.  The Brunch menu is small on the scale of other restaurants but it is packed full of flavor.  If I wasn't feeling the French toast, I was thinking about the goulash.

I've had a pleasant experience every time I go here. OK, what am I saying? This place kicks butt!!!! The potatoes that come with your meal are to die for! The bad breath burger is awesome, love the name.    It gets quite busy though, so expect a wait around dinner time.  But have a drink at the bar, and enjoy some nice company. Once you get seated, there is a corner in the back FULL of games, so break out some scrabble.   This place is truly a Madison favorite of mine. Delicious food (veggie options). Can't remember how the service was last time, but I've gone back, so it couldn't have been terrible.  Awesome, cozy place!

Fantastic food! The bobs bad breath burger is a must! Service was friendly,fast, and overall just a wonderful experience. Also, they have a good amount of beers on tap. The prices are a little above average but it is definitely worth it!

Love this place! 5 stars alone for ambiance. Bad breath burger, tilapia sandwich and west andes sandwich are all to die for. Guess you could say Weary Traveler has the best sandwiches in Madison, definitely on Willy. The tom kha soup is also to die for. Small but selective beer selection.   And I can't say enough about the ambiance. A little dark if you wanna go during the day though.

The food is amazing. I have only eaten here twice but every time I do I want to go back and eat more immediately after leaving. The staff is always pleasant. They seem genuine and don't "bother you" more than checking in - which is exactly what I enjoy. Both experiences were a 5!

We arrived early around 6pm for dinner and were greeted promptly. We thoroughly enjoyed the South of the border plate as an appetizer. The pickled mix was hot and spicy. Fresh ingredients in the guacamole and pico.  Bob's burger was good and filling. The salmon was tender and moist. The quinoa salad has lots of flavor. Service by the entire staff was exceptional. The vegan chocolate caramel cashew tort finished of a great dining experience in a quaint atmosphere.

For just two of us this place was great and we got seats at the bar immediately. I think  larger parties (5+) could have a tough time getting a table but once they did they wouldn't be disappointed. The carne asada plate was delicious!

Been there numerous times for the past 10 years. The food and service are consistently good. You get waited on right away and food comes fairly fast, they also serve food late which can be handy if you find yourself hungry at midnight. The ingredients are very fresh and high quality, the cooks know what they're doing. The West of the Andes sandwich never disappoints. The Chicken Dijonnaise with mashed potatoes and green beans and a Dijon Cream sauce is yummy! They also have vegetarian and vegan choices like the grilled vegetables platter (Very good!), Vegan Chili and Baked Stuffed Squash. Waitstaff is friendly and efficient.

Cozy atmosphere tucked into a cute neighborhood in Madison. The servers are friendly, helpful, and gave good recommendations. I had the Knausgaard Sandwich - Nueske's smoked ham, Carr Valley Gouda & Roth Grand Cru melted on house-made potato bread with whole grain mustard, refrigerator pickles & caramelized onions. Served with cottage cheese and cherry tomatoes. $10.75  Their wine is really cheap - most glasses were under $6. They also have a full bar with lots of yummy-sounding tequila cocktails.  I want to come back on a cold winter day, order the Hungarian Goulash, a dark Porter, and play one of the board games they have available.
The food was so bomb. It really was. Impressive drink menu. Bar has a laid-back "Cheers" feel. Bartenders were great but my server was average, which is the only reason this is 4/5 & not 5/5.

Let's face it: we love the Weary Traveler because of the Bad Breath Burger.  The rest of the menu is passable, the service is good enough, the location is alright.  The reason we go to the Weary Traveler is the Bad Breath Burger, simply the best burger in Madison, Wisconsin.  Bun = lightly toasted, just a bit of butter flavor  Meat = organic, flavorful, delicious  Cream cheese = cool, rich counterpoint to burger and bread  Carmelized onions = just the right dose of savory  Green goddess sauce = the piece de resistance  I have to stop because I'm making myself very hungry ...

Great tavern-style, quirky restaurant with boardgames and a diverse menu. It's got a dark, cute atmosphere with lots of kitch.  The service is friendly and once you order they let you stay as long as you'd like and never make you feel pressured to leave. The only small knock I have is that the service is slow, but that's to be expected of a busy restaurant that lets you dine/drink/schmooze at your own pace.

Weary traveler has the best crowd. Food is great and I love the vegan options!  Th grog will leave you with an absolute hangover that was absolutely deserved! Great spot and highly recommend stopping by!

Excellent in so many ways. The atmosphere is really great, so chill.  The food is basic comfort food . You just can't go wrong w/whatever you order.  Service is really great but you can't be in a hurry. Relax, it's all good!

Nice place for some good, unique dishes and fun drinks. We came for dinner and started out with the Meat and Cheese platter. It was not at all what I expected, unfortunately. It was basically a deli platter. It had sliced cheese and sliced meat that looked like it could have been from Subway. I wasn't impressed.   For my main course, I went with the Hungarian Goulash and it was delicious. Very flavorful and had nice bread that went with it, to soak up all the broth.   The atmosphere is fun and trendy. Definitely a good spot to stop in for a drink, or for a meal. I will be back.
TIM. Get the beef West of the Andes sammich!

The Weary Traveler is perfect for a Sunday afternoon or a cozy weekday dinner.   I've been a few times for various occasions, and I definitely like their soups and appetizers best. They have an assortment of games and cards on the shelf, so it's fun to grab a few beers and hang out for a while, but not on a weekend night.   The Tom Ka is really good, as is the hummus platter. I've tried the corn quinoa salad and my friends go crazy over the bad breath burger, to name a few favorite menu options.  I would try it out if you haven't been, but definitely avoid Friday and Saturday nights. They tend to be packed with long waits and sub-par service.

Went here a few times with my boyfriend and man it is always so good. The food is really fresh and I love this spot. It's almost a hidden spot that has local and organic foods from Madison. I love it and the prices are very inexpensive as well.

First time in Wisconsin. Found this bar/restaurant on Yelp and read the good reviews. Me & a coworker decided to try it and it was a home run! Great draft beers, very good food and affordable. Ambiance was very cool - I would recommend to anyone passing through!

Really enjoyed my meal here! The environment is very chill/casual and I enjoyed their Bad Breath burger (I got it with no bun) a lot! I usually am bummed out when places serve burgers with chips and not fries - but their homemade chips are seasoned well and have a potato-y taste still. The burger was a slam dunk though - loved the cream cheese on it! Would definitely come back here. As far as cons go, the menu itself is rather limited - I could see it being tricky for some people to find a dish they'd enjoy, and they don't really have traditional appetizers for an American joint. Overall worth trying for the burger!

I took some out-of-town guests to WT, purely based on the previous reviews here on Yelp and OH MY GOD! This place is great! Granted, it was a loud Friday night, but I was expecting (and even welcoming) that sort of environment. I was absolutely blown away by the food. When I skimmed the prices on the menu (before actually reading the item names), I mistakenly assumed I was looking at an appetizer menu! The prices are rock bottom, and yet the quality and character of the fare was outstanding. I'll be making sure to visit here again.  I'm no hippie, but I did feel at ease with the lack of any TVs in sight of our table and Michael Franti's voice barely audible in the background.  Maybe next time, I'll challenge my dinner guests to a friendly game of connect four -- yep, they've got a rack full of classic board/table/card games for those of us that prefer to interact with our friends while enjoying a pint as opposed to screaming at a sports game on TV.  pure. genius.

I've always had good service at the Weary Traveler. The waitstaff are generally friendly and knowledgeable, and they seem to take a decent amount of pride in doing a good job. I've been there by myself or with fairly large groups, and in all cases I enjoyed myself.  There are a couple items on the menu that make this a must-visit for anyone who can spend a day or two in Madison. The Bob's Bad Breath Burger is a real treat (and worth the hour in the pool I have to spend to work some of it off), and the Walleye Sandwich is without a doubt the best fish sandwich on this planet. It is one of the few walleye sandwiches around that is not breaded. It is broiled to perfection and topped with a tartar sauce-like aioli that complements the flavor of the fish perfectly. It's always nice to have a healthy option that blows everything else on the menu out of the water.
Be sure to get the vegan chill with cornbread. The chili is slightly spicy, but good. The cornbread is awesome, too!

Really cool, funky place on Willy St. Food and atmosphere are great, service can be spotty at times through.  It is seat yourself and can get confusing at times. They have gotten better at having someone take names on busy nights but years ago it was kinda of a free for all. My husband and I love the board games they have on the back wall. We used to come and play scrabble or yahtzee before our dinner.  The food is awesome here. The bad breath burger is definitely one of the best burgers is Madison. It comes with a side of crispy, sliced garlicky potatoes and a small salad. The burger has caramelized onions, cream cheese among other things. Its delicious! Their Hungarian goulash is really tasty, you can get a cup or a bowl. I've also had their Dijon chicken with mash potatoes also super yummy. The salsa and chip platter  or hummus plate are nice starters too. Pretty much anything you get here will be good.

I've been to the Weary Traveler twice now over the last year, and each experience has left me scratching my head as to why there are so many fans of this place.  If the Traveler has any strong stuff going for it, it's that there is a very pleasant atmosphere and a good location.  Sequestered about a block from the Willy St. Co-op, The Weary Traveler is in one of those neighborhoods that offers almost everything you could want.  Great restaurants, fun bars, unique mom-and-pop stores, and hipster people with generally good attitudes.  The restaurant itself has a nice ambiance that promotes relaxation and talk with friends, and the staff is impeccably polite.  All that said, I've had some issues with the place.  First, their menu is ridiculously limited.  You're handed a sheet of paper with about a dozen options on it including the appetizers, and a lot of the items are basically the same thing.  Case in point, - Bad Breath Burger, Ace Burger, Carne Asada, etc.  Chicken Breast with vegetables, Grill Cheese, Rueben.  While each dish is written about as if it's something magnificent, to me it was just hard to buy into the ingenuity.  Between myself and several friends I've now seen the majority of the dishes offered and had a taste, and I simply wasn't impressed.  The burger was tasty, but not the best I've had, all of the meat was red and a choice was never given on that (even though I tend to like more rare food, this both times was questionably so).  Portion sizes also varied; some were incredibly huge, others left one wanting to attend a second restaurant.  I do applaud them for a little originality with the sides.  Instead of the typical "burger and fries," my burger had carrots and graham crackers.  If anything, this was my favorite part of that particular meal as I almost always want more vegetables when eating out then what's offered and the crackers were yum-tastic.  Both times I went, the wait time for getting our meal was horribly long.  The first time, there was just about no one in the restaurant, but we still sat there for 45 minutes with maybe one peek-in from our waitress to make sure our drink glasses were filled.  The second time, not only did that same behavior occur, but on top of it we had a 40 minute wait just to be seated because it was so crowded you couldn't even move.  Now I'll be the first man to say it's absolutely worth the wait at a good restaurant, but that's just it; I wasn't impressed.  Perhaps I'm being too harsh on the poor old Traveler, but when I'm yelping I try to put up more reviews for places that I could strongly recommend people to go.  And with all the other fantastic options on Willy Street, this is certainly not a spot I'd recommend going.

Once upon a midnight dreary, while I pondered weak and weary....suddenly there came...burgers!   And really good burgers.  As we all know, ya just gotsa get the Bob's Bad Breath Burger. Cream cheese, green goddess dressing, caramelized onions, garlic, tomato, pickapeppa sauce. It's messy. It's goooood.   Similarly delicious is their West of the Andes beef tenderloin sandwich with avocado, pico de gallo, and chipotle mayo. If you're into that sorta thang.  We also tried the Carne Asada of marinated flank steak, guacamole, pico de gallo, grilled scallion, tortilla chips, and spicy escabeche pickled vegetables. The steak was glorious.   I love their Japanese sukara cherry green tea by the way.

Ah, my old stomping grounds. Used to go here all the time to see my friend's bluegrass band. I love the food: med plate is great although short on pita, the burger is heavenly but will in fact make your breath smell like hell, the porkchops are worth the price, and the tom ka tofu soup's a killer. The thing I can't forgive though is that they got rid of the Sunday brunch. They had the most amazing almond buttermilk pancakes that were all-you-can-eat. Why oh why did that end? Moving on, this was often the place that I started my nights, and then ended up staying and ending them there as well. And was never worse off for it.
Try the Walleye sandwich.  It's what brought me there and it's what keeps me coming back.  Also try the vegetarian chili.  Out of sight!

This place is pretty cool. As nerdy as this will sound it did make me feel like I was dining in some old inn before my voyage to find a ring and/or horcrux. The lighting is very dim which I liked. I ordered the salad with black beans, corn, avocado, and steak. Food was seasoned well and tasted amazing. I tried the kombucha and vodka drink which was also amazing. I also had some Thai soup. It wasn't bad but it felt a bit thin. Maybe rice on the side would've helped it feel more like a meal? Still would recommend this place.

Big fan of the Weary.  Good food at a very nice price.  Full bar and good selection of beer.  The only downside is there is usually a wait.  I am a fan of the Carne Asada, the Chicken Dijonaise, and the West of the Andes Sandwich.  I would like to try more but I always keep coming back for those dishes.

I don't really know how to describe the best piece of roasted chicken in my life?  It was just perfect.  A perfectly seasoned chicken breast with garlic potatoes and green beans that I am still craving even a week later.  I did have some issues with this restaurant however.  There wasn't much of a variety to choose from and the prices I felt were a little high.  I am sure one is paying for location given where the restaurant is located, but I would like to see more choice in the future.

The Weary Traveler Free House is a cozy little tavern in the Willy St. neighborhood on the East side of town.  Bar food that tastes like it's been made with some care.  Bob's Bad Breath Burger and the West of the Andes sandwich are always big hits.  Fantastic selection of beer on tap (Lake Louie and Great Dane are two highlights) and solid bartenders.  Can sometimes be a victim of its own success; Friday and Saturday nights can be really crowded and you're always standing in the way of the waitstaff.

FOOD/DRINKS: The food here is very good. A few of my favorites are the West of the Andes sandwich, Bob's Bad Breath Burger, and Hungarian Goulash. I like that they have things you don't see everywhere else like kombucha with vodka!  AMBIANCE: It has a dark, cozy, intimate vibe. It can get pretty loud. Best enjoyed with one other person or a small group. The tables are pretty small.  SERVICE: I've always had friendly service, but sometimes it's a bit slow. It depends how busy the restaurant is. It's better to go on a Sunday afternoon or at least to avoid peak times when it gets really busy.

Stumbled across this spot while on a work trip in Madison, and now I dream of their Tom Ka soup.  I rolled in solo as a real-life weary traveler and people watched for a good three hours from a corner table.   From an observers point of view, it seemed like this was the kind of place you went to for the whole night. It's not the spot you go to for a quick bite or beer. Nearly everyone who came in settled in for the long haul. There were lots of board games and books lying around that you could bring to your table, and the seating was crowded enough to make inter-table mingling a very easy task.  This is definitely the kind of place I would frequent if I lived here.   And again, the Tom Ka soup ruined me. Nowhere else I've been has beat it since, even some of my favorite Thai places.
Great decor, great service, Great homemade food using local ingredients!

The Goulash, the salads, the sandwiches: there's a reason this place has a line on weekends and Friday nights!  If you're looking for a great atmosphere and good filling food, this place is for you. Don't get discouraged by the Willy Street parking, this place is worth walking too.

I went here again with my girlfriend recently and we were sadly disappointed. I'm hoping it was an "off" night.   We started off with a chips and guac sampler that was delicious, although really, its hard to screw that up. We then moved onto main courses and it was here that the meal went awry.   I had a bowl of the chili which was just not...good. The flavor seemed off, and with way too much chopped onion. It felt as if I was eating a dish of chopped onion in vaguely chili-flavored tomato juice. The cornbread was dry as well. My girlfriend, the meat eater, got meat in hers and described it as "stringy"--odd for tenderloin tips, I think.   I also had a salad, which while good, wasn't as good as I remembered last time. The avocados were not quite ripe, which gave it a totally different texture.   Last but not least, our nearly sixty-dollar tab (including beer) for okay chili, salad, and chips seemed...excessive? We felt like we got ripped off, not a great feeling for a date night. I would eat here again, but now I'm worried about consistency so it might be a while.

FINALLY CHRIS B. HAS COME BACK TO THE WEARY!    And you know something, jabroni?  It's been 6 long years, but the Weary still laid the smack down all over our family table.  And no, Chris B. wasn't in the mood for pie.  He was in the mood to have the best guaran-damn-teed late-night culinary extravaganza on the east side of Madison!  Let's start with the West of the Andes sandwich.  This is a sandwich that will make you shut your mouth and know your role, which is to enjoy the delicious tangy salsa, fresh greens, and perfectly spicy chipotle sauce.  Mmm... Last time Chris B.  was here he had it with roasted veggies, however, since that time he joined the millions... and millions of seafood fans, and had it with tuna steak.    You say you can't find spicy food in Madison?  You say that most places won't just bring it?  Well Chris B. says you should check your roody-poo candy-ass directly into the Weary Traveler, at the corner of Know Your Role Boulevard and Jabroni Drive (actually Williamson and Few), and go one-on-one with the Great One: The Weary Traveler's Tom Kha Tofu soup.  Oh, and that reminds Chris B.  What's your favorite beer?  IT DOESN'T MATTER WHAT YOUR FAVORITE BEER IS!    Because when you go step into the squared circle and go toe-to-toe with the beer selection of the-most-electrifying-late-night-eastside-Madison-cafe, you'll find only the finest Wisconsin beers for the perfect matchup.  Now Chris B. knows that some say that Schlitz is what made Milwaukee's monkey ass famous.  Well Chris B. says that for his meal he chose Tommy's Porter, brewed by Lake Louie out of Arena, Wisconsin, an appropriate location for a brewery that LAYETH THE SMACKETH DOWN with every bottle!  Only one question remains then, jabroni.  Do you smell what the Weary is cookin?!
Extremely happy!!! They know how to make a proper Manhattan! Very accommodating. Great atmosphere and great service. Would love to keep drinking here in the future.
Amazing service and food. I love the Madison staple of the mixed salad as the side, and everything was cooked to perfection. I will definitely come back during my travels.
Hot Butter Rum!  That was my drink & it was wonderful!   (Here endth the review!0

Weary Traveler is not perfect, but may well be as perfect as you can get this side of Eden.  There's all sorts of quirky art hanging on the walls and out of commission instruments.  The staff is just about at hipster-lovely-awesome as you can get.  And the menu is (despite being short...and it is short) thoughtfully put together and constructed from locally sourced (when possible) high-quality items.  The whole space as a feeling of shabby-chic that automatically endears itself to me.  The atmosphere is dark and intimate, but the place is usually pretty full, so be prepared to wait  (P.S.Just have a beer and get over it!)  A last word of praise: Tonight we ordered the chicken, which when got appeared under cooked, so we asked the waitress to take it back, which she did.  When she brought it back out, it was amazing and they had doubled a our side items, which also tasted amazing.

Been here twice, and would probably come back if I were in the area and needed something reliable. I had the West of the Andes sandwich (with tuna) once, which was really good. Can't go wrong with avocado, tuna and chipotle mayo. The other time, I had the chili, but don't remember what it was like. I also had a really unique hot tea, but don't remember what it was called.... apologies for my poor memory.   This place has a pretty hipster vibe, and is really laid back. We hung out there for a few hours without the waiter bothering us, which was nice. It's the kind of place where you could kick it with friends for a few hours and not spend a ton of money.   It was pretty easy to find parking on Willy Street, and I didn't have to wait either time I came here.
Fun place, good vegan options. Great drinks. Their vegan chili is excellent.

I really enjoy the Weary. I have been coming here for years and each visit has been great.   The bartenders and staff have always been nice and attentive. The food is wonderful. The ambiance is great. There's really nothing to complain about here.   I brought a friend in just the other day. She had never been so I was curious to see what she thought. She loved it! (I knew she would ;))   The menu isn't huge, but it has something for everyone. Another nice thing about Weary is that they have a lot of vegetarian options for the veggies who come in. I ordered chili last time I was there and they always ask if you want it with or without meat. It's nice they do that.

I don't care if you're on a first date, a vampire, or some kindof strange gum or deodorant professional whose job it is to smell good all the time, you order the Bad Breath Burger because it is the most garlicy-cheesy-delicious piece of cow you will ever have.  I miss this place so much and tell everyone I know to go there for the burger alone, but everything else on the menu is terrific as well.
Went for dinner last night.  We had the bad breath burger, and the walleye sammy.  Both were pretty good, but not like "wow, I'll be craving this now".
